Class IOT_OperationEditSegmentation

Operation EditSegmentation

Log:
Date Author Description
5-Aug-2018 FOE
  • Isolated minimal solution.
  • Encapsulated in class.
22-Aug-2018 FOE
  • Class name rebranded to capital “O” in operation
  • Improved verbosity; now using class name
26-Aug-2018 FOE
  • Dummy segmentation now takes into account IOT_RetinalLayers
  • Added constant for background
  • Incorporated the initial functionality; ROISelect, ROIDeselect, ROIDelete, ROIRelabel
  • Debugged getROIPixels; it now correctly parcellates background connected components
23-Sep-2018 FOE
  • Updated comments and added Sphinx documentation to the class.
15-Nov-2018 FOE
  • Dummy segmentation now results in a full segmentation and returns an IOT_OCTscanSegmentation
1-Dec-2018 FOE
  • Adapted to IOT_Operation becoming abstract and new capabilities. Added method .execute, integration of operands, given operation name, deprecated method initEditSegmentation.
  • Updated attributes activeROI and activeCOI to properties.
  • ROISelect method now searches for a labelled ROI within a neighobourhood.
9-Jan-2019 FOE
  • Bug detected. Variable imgin in method execute had not been set.
13-Dec-2018 FOE
  • Updated deprecation package to “deprecation” due compilation problems with package “deprecated”.

class src.IOT_OperationEditSegmentation.IOT_OperationEditSegmentation[source]¶

Bases: IOT_Operation.IOT_Operation

Operation EditSegmentation

This class permits manual manipulation of a segmentation of retinal layers from an OCT image. The class provides its functionality by manipulating local regions of interest (ROI) and or Classes of interest (COI) in the segmentation. A ROI is just a connected set of pixels with the same label. A COI is the set of all ROIs sharing the same label.

The class provides a set of basic operations for selecting and then maniplating some ROI or COI in a segmentation; including:

  • Delete
  • Change label

Whether working with ROI or COI always select the active COI or ROI before applying an operation.

See also

None

Note

Operand is an class:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation, but a reference image can be hold as the class:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation attribute scan

BACKGROUND = 0¶
COIChangeLabel(newClassID, coi=None)[source]¶

Updates the label of the current active COI

Updates the label of the current active COI or the selected COI (if argument coi is provided).

The newClassID becomes the new updated COI.

..note: This removes the current active COI from the segmentation,
since no pixel with the current label will remain in the segmentation. If you only want to affect some ROI, then use func:ROIChangeLabel instead
Parameters:
  • newClassID (int) – The new class ID.
  • coi (int) – The class ID to be changed. Default None
Returns:

The modified segmentation.
Return type:

IOT_OCTscanSegmentation
COIDelete(classID=None)[source]¶

Deletes the COI identified by classID.

Deletes the COI identified by classID. Sets the COI to BACKGROUND If classID is None, then it works over the current active COI.

Parameters:classID (int) – A class ID. Default None
Returns:The modified segmentation.
Return type:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation
COISelect(classID)[source]¶

Select a COI by its label.

Select a COI by its label. If the classID is not found in the segmentation, then the BACKGROUND is selected.

Parameters:classID (int) – A class ID.
Returns:True if the class ID is present in the segmentation or False otherwise (BACKGROUND selected).
Return type:bool
ROIChangeLabel(newClassID, pos=None)[source]¶

Updates the label of the current active ROI

Updates the label of the current active ROI or the selected ROI (if argument pos is provided).

If provided, pos becomes the new py:attr:activeROI

..note: This removes the current active ROI from the segmentation,
since no pixel with the current label will remain in the segmentation. If you only want to affect some ROI, then use ROIChangeLabel instead.
Parameters:
  • newClassID (IOT_OCTscan) – A reference OCT scan
  • pos (tuple or list) – A pixel/voxel of the ROI; (x,y) or (x,y,z). Default None.
Returns:

The modified segmentation.
Return type:

IOT_OCTscanSegmentation
ROIDelete(pos=None)[source]¶

Deletes the current active ROI and sets it to BACKGROUND

Sets the label of the current active ROI or the selected ROI (if argument pos is provided) to BACKGROUND.

If provided, pos becomes the new py:attr:activeROI

Parameters:pos (tuple or list) – A pixel/voxel of the ROI; (x,y) or (x,y,z). Default None.
Returns:The modified segmentation.
Return type:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation
ROISelect(pos, radius=10)[source]¶

Select the closest labelled ROI within some radius (in pixels) of pos.

Select the closest labelled ROI within some radius (in pixels) of pos or the BACKGROUND if no labelled region is found.

If pos correspond to a labelled region, then it becomes the py:attr:activeROI, and True is returned.

If pos is in the BACKGROUND, and it is at the same distance of more than one labelled regions, then the selected ROI is pick at random (actually it selects the first found from the top left) and True is returned.

If pos is in the BACKGROUND, and no labelled region is found in the neighbourhood, then pos becomes the new py:attr:activeROI and False is returned.

..note: To select a specific ROI regardless of its class ID (e.g.
enforce selection of a BACKGROUND pixel), simply assign some value to property py:attr:activeROI
Parameters:
  • pos (tuple or list) – A pixel/voxel of the ROI; (x,y) or (x,y,z)
  • radius (uint) – Radius in pixels. Default value is 10 pixels
Returns:

True if a labelled ROI has been found or False otherwise
Return type:

bool
activeCOI¶

Currently active COI.

The COI is identified by its class ID.

Getter:Gets the active COI
Setter:Sets the active COI
Type:tuple
activeROI¶

Currently active ROI.

The ROI is identified by a position tuple (x,y[,z]) indicating any pixel ROI. The ROI itself is all the connected of the component to this pixel. The class of the ROI corresponds the label at (x,y[,z])

Getter:Gets the active ROI
Setter:Sets the active ROI to (x,y[,z]).
Type:tuple
execute(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Executes the operation on the operands.

Executes the operation on the operands and stores the outcome in result. Preload operands using IOT:Operation.addOperand().

Parameters:editType (String) – A string indicating the type of edition
Returns:Result of executing the operation.
Return type:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation

initEditSegmentation(refImage, imageSegmented=None)[source]¶

Initialize segmentation for editing from reference IOT_OCTscan.

Parameters:
  • refImage (IOT_OCTscan) – A reference OCT scan
  • imageSegmented (IOT_OCTscanSegmentation) – The operand. A segmentation over parameter refImage.
Returns:

An initialized edit segmentation operation.
Return type:

IOT_OCTscanSegmentation

Deprecated since version 0.2: This will be removed in 0.3. Use method addOperand() and add reference image as scan property of class:IOT_OCTscanSegmentation.
